com.xhive.dom.interfaces
Interface XhiveLibraryIf

All Superinterfaces:
DocumentTraversal, DOMImplementation, DOMImplementationLS, Node, XhiveLibraryChildIf, XhiveLockingContextIf, XhiveNodeIf
public interface XhiveLibraryIf
extends XhiveLibraryChildIf, DOMImplementation, DOMImplementationLS, DocumentTraversal

A library is a collection of documents and other libraries. Libraries are somewhat special in comparison to other Nodes, because:

  • A library acts as a namescope, making it possible to assign names to child nodes of a library.
  • By adding library child indexes, the performance and scalability of lookup of childnodes by name or id is increased.

You can assign names to child nodes of libraries using the setName method of either XhiveDocumentIf or XhiveLibraryIf. A child can have only one name, which must be unique within its library context. When you remove a document or library from its parent, its name is also removed from the namescope.

To enhance performance of search for children of a library by name or id, the user can add an library child id index or a library child name index.These indexes increase performance and scalability of the get(String name), get(long id) and setName methods. By default, a library is created with a library name index. Create these indexes by using functions addLibraryIdIndex or addLibraryNameIndex of class XhiveIndexListIf. The indexlist can be obtained by using function getIndexList.

The root-library is by default created with a library child name index and a library child id index.

The locking behaviour of a library is controlled by the lockswithparent flag. You can only set this flag when creating the library. Create a library which locks with its parent by using option LOCKS_WITH_PARENT in function create-library.

If the lockswithparent flag is true, both the current library and its parent are locked whenever a change is made to either of these libraries.

If the lockswithparent flag is false, changes to the current library do not lock the parent, and vice versa.

A library is locked implicitly whenever you make a change to the library (or to one of its children, if the child library has lockswithparent=true). Examples of changes include using a createXXX method, appendChild, and so on.

You can also lock a library child explicitly by using the XhiveLockingContextIf.lock(int) method. Doing so prevents exceptions later on.

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
more info about lock()., more info about index types, their live behaviour and internal usage.

Field Detail

LOCK_WITH_PARENT

static final short LOCK_WITH_PARENT
Flag controlling locking behaviour. When set, the library is locked with its parent.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

DOCUMENTS_DO_NOT_LOCK_WITH_PARENT

static final short DOCUMENTS_DO_NOT_LOCK_WITH_PARENT
Flag controlling locking behaviour. When set, each document in the library will get its own locking context, which means that it will not automaticly be locked with the library.
Please note that this option is mostly targeted towards libraries with a relatively fixed set of documents that are changed often through DOM operations:
  • Using this option only has an effect on actions on documents in the library themselves. If you add or remove documents to or from the library, it will still be locked.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 3.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_NO_VALIDATION

static final int PARSER_NO_VALIDATION
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, no validation is performed.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED

static final int PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, namespace handling is enabled.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_KEEP_WHITESPACES

static final int PARSER_KEEP_WHITESPACES
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, no whitespace stripping is performed during parsing.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_NORMALIZE

static final int PARSER_NORMALIZE
Deprecated. In practice, this option has no effect since all text is put into one text-node by default.
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, the document is normalized during parsing. Normalized means that there shall be neither adjacent Text nodes nor empty Text nodes in the DOM after parsing.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_IGNORE_PUBLIC_ID

static final int PARSER_IGNORE_PUBLIC_ID
Deprecated. use PARSER_IGNORE_CATALOG instead.
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, encountered DTDs are stored (when parsing in validating mode), but without any PUBLIC id should they have one. Moreover, PUBLIC ids are not resolved against the catalog (the default behaviour is to try to use schemas from the catalog during parsing, based on the public identifiers).

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_IGNORE_CATALOG

static final int PARSER_IGNORE_CATALOG
Flag controlling parser behaviour. During validated parsing, the corresponding DTD's and XML schemas in the catalog are ignored.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_OMIT_ENTITY_REFERENCES

static final int PARSER_OMIT_ENTITY_REFERENCES
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, the content of encountered entity references is placed in the document, but the entity references themselves are not put in the resulting DOM. If entity references are omitted, entities (in the doctype declaration) will not have their contents entered.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
Constant Field Values

PARSER_PSVI

static final int PARSER_PSVI
Flag controlling parser behaviour. When set, psvi information is stored on elements and attributes. Documents parsed with this feature turned on, give access to psvi information and enable support of data types by XQuery queries.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

createLibrary

XhiveLibraryIf createLibrary()
Create a new library with default poperties. The new library is to be inserted into the current library by using DOM function appendChild or insertBefore. The new library has the following default properties:
  • The new library is not locked with its parent.
  • The optimization is equal to the optimization of the current (future parent) library.
  • The new library has no library child name or id index.

Returns:
the new library
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
more information about locking contexts., more information about library child name and id indexes

createLibrary

XhiveLibraryIf createLibrary(int options)
Create a new library with locking and optimization properties. The new library is to be inserted into the current library by using DOM function appendChild or insertBefore. The new library has the following default property:
  • The new library has no library child name or id index.
  • The new library is not locked with its parent.
  • The optimization is equal to the optimization of the current (future parent) library.

Parameters:
options - a combination of one or more of the following options: LOCK_WITH_PARENT, DOCUMENTS_DO_NOT_LOCK_WITH_PARENT.
Returns:
the new library
Since:
X-Hive/DB 2.0
See Also:
more information about locking contexts., more information about library child name and id indexes

                                   DocumentType doctype)
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.1

getCatalog

XhiveCatalogIf getCatalog()
Get the catalog for this library. By default, only the root-library has a catalog, but you can set a local catalog by calling addLocalCatalog() on a library. When that is done, catalog operations on that library or its descendants will first call on this library.

Returns:
The catalog for this library, or the catalog of its first parent library that does have a catalog if this library does not have one.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

hasLocalCatalog

boolean hasLocalCatalog()
Check whether this library itself has a catalog.

Returns:
true if this library has its own catalog, false if it shares a catalog with an ancestor library.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

addLocalCatalog

void addLocalCatalog()
Add a new catalog on this library, for local use.

Throws:
XhiveException.CATALOG_ALREADY_PRESENT - If there is already a catalog set on this library.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

removeLocalCatalog

void removeLocalCatalog()
Remove the local catalog from this library.

Throws:
XhiveException.CATALOG_CANNOT_REMOVE - If you are trying to remove the catalog from the root-library.
XhiveException.CATALOG_NOT_PRESENT - If there was no catalog on this library.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 4.0

get

XhiveLibraryChildIf get(long id)
Get a library child by its unique identifier. If a library was created with an id index, this method uses the index to look up the library child, otherwise it needs to search in its list of child nodes.

Parameters:
id - The id of the requested child.
Returns:
The library child requested, or null when the library child is not available.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

get

XhiveLibraryChildIf get(long id,
                        int lockType)
Get a library child by its unique identifier and lock it. This is like get(long), but additionally, if the retrieved child is not locked yet, it will be locked in the specified mode. If the child will be updated concurrently in different sessions, this can be useful to avoid deadlocks.

Parameters:
id - The id of the requested child.
lockType - One of XhiveLockingContextIf.READ, XhiveLockingContextIf.WRITE, XhiveLockingContextIf.UPDATE.
Returns:
The library child requested, or null when the library child is not available.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

get

XhiveLibraryChildIf get(java.lang.String name)
Get a library child by its name. If a library was created with a name index, this method uses the index to look up the library child, otherwise it needs to search in its list of child nodes.

Parameters:
name - The name of the library child.
Returns:
The library child requested, or null when the library child is not available.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

get

XhiveLibraryChildIf get(java.lang.String name,
                        int lockType)
Get a document by its name and lock it. This is like get(String), but additionally, if the retrieved child is not locked yet, it will be locked in the specified mode. If the child will be updated concurrently in different sessions, this can be useful to avoid deadlocks.

Parameters:
name - The name of the library child.
lockType - One of XhiveLockingContextIf.READ, XhiveLockingContextIf.WRITE, XhiveLockingContextIf.UPDATE.
Returns:
The library child requested, or null when the library child is not available.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 7.0

the number of child nodes

getDatabase

XhiveDatabaseIf getDatabase()
Get the database object in which the library is placed.

Returns:
The database object.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

importNode

XhiveNodeIf importNode(Node importedNode,
                       boolean deep)
Import documents or libraries or BLOBs from other DOM implementations or other libraries, so that they can appended to this library.
The copy is very shallow. Properties besides the name, index information as well as catalog information on the libraries and documents imported as well as versioning information is not copied.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

adoptNode

XhiveLibraryChildIf adoptNode(Node source)
Adopt library children into this library. Changes the owner of the library child so that it can be appended to this library. If necessary, it is first removed from its original parent.

If a versioned document is adopted, all its branches are adopted as well. It is not possible to adopt a temporary document, because temporary data is stored in a different (more efficient, as durability is not required) way.

Parameters:
source - The library child to adopt.
Returns:
The adopted node.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 6.0

parseDocument

XhiveDocumentIf parseDocument(java.net.URL url)
                              throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Parse an XML 1.0 document and return the corresponding DOM level 2 Document interface. The parser has the following default settings:

  • The parser validates the document.

  • Namespaces are not supported.

  • White space is ignored.

  • The document is not explicitly normalized after parsing.

In most cases, you will want to specify the PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED option (even if your documents do not contain namespace information).

Parameters:
url - the URL of the XML document.
Returns:
Document, a W3C DOM Document.
Throws:
PARSE_ERROR - with an error message when:

  • The XML is not correct.

  • An I/O error occurred.

  • A parser configuration error occurred.

org.xml.sax.SAXException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

parseDocument

XhiveDocumentIf parseDocument(java.net.URL url,
                              int options)
                              throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Parse an XML 1.0 document and return the corresponding DOM level 2 Document interface. The parser has the following default settings:

  • The parser validates the document.

  • Namespaces are not supported.

  • White space is ignored.

  • The document is not explicitly normalized after parsing.

In most cases, you will want to specify the PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED option (even if your documents do not contain namespace information).

Parameters:
url - the URL of the XML document.
options - a combination of one or more of the following options: PARSER_NO_VALIDATION, PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED, PARSER_KEEP_WHITESPACES, PARSER_NORMALIZE, PARSER_IGNORE_PUBLIC_ID.
Returns:
Document, a W3C DOM Document.
Throws:
PARSE_ERROR - with an error message when:

  • The XML is not correct.

  • An I/O error occurred.

  • A parser configuration error occurred.

org.xml.sax.SAXException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

parseDocument

XhiveDocumentIf parseDocument(org.xml.sax.InputSource source)
                              throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Parse an XML 1.0 document and return the corresponding DOM level 2 Document interface. When parsing succeeds, the document is added to the library with an unique id generated by X-Hive/DB. The parser has the following default settings:

  • The parser validates the document.

  • Namespaces are not supported.

  • White space is ignored.

  • The document is not explicitly normalized after parsing.

In most cases, you will want to specify the PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED option (even if your documents do not contain namespace information).

Parameters:
source - the InputSource of the XML document (when parsing with external entities, it is wise to set the system id of the inputsource to a non-null value).
Returns:
Document a W3C DOM Document.
Throws:
PARSE_ERROR - with an error message when:

  • The XML is not correct.

  • An I/O error occurred.

  • A parser configuration error occurred.

Note: All references to external entities (such as DTDs) in the input source must be absolute. Relative paths cannot be resolved.
org.xml.sax.SAXException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

parseDocument

XhiveDocumentIf parseDocument(org.xml.sax.InputSource source,
                              int options)
                              throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
Parse an XML 1.0 document and return the corresponding DOM level 2 Document interface. When parsing succeeds, the document is added to the library with an unique id generated by X-Hive/DB. The parser has the following default settings:

  • The parser validates the document.

  • Namespaces are not supported.

  • White space is ignored.

  • The document is not explicitly normalized after parsing.

In most cases, you will want to specify the PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED option (even if your documents do not contain namespace information).

Parameters:
source - the InputSource of the XML document (when parsing with external entities, it is wise to set the system id of the inputsource to a non-null value).
options - a combination of one or more of the following options: PARSER_NO_VALIDATION, PARSER_NAMESPACES_ENABLED, PARSER_KEEP_WHITESPACES, PARSER_NORMALIZE, PARSER_IGNORE_PUBLIC_ID.
Returns:
Document, a W3C DOM Document.
Throws:
PARSE_ERROR - with an error message when:

  • The XML is not correct.

  • An I/O error occurred.

  • A parser configuration error occurred.

Note: All references to external entities (such as DTDs) in the input source must be absolute. Relative paths cannot be resolved.
org.xml.sax.SAXException
Since:
X-Hive/DB 1.1

getChildSegmentId

java.lang.String getChildSegmentId()
Get the database segment that is used for new children and indexes of this library.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

setChildSegmentId

void setChildSegmentId(java.lang.String id)
Set the database segment that will contain all new children and indexes of this library. Setting this to null implies the segment that contains the library itself. The selected segment cannot be a temporary data segment.

Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.0

deserialize

XhiveLibraryChildIf deserialize(java.io.InputStream in)
                                throws java.io.IOException
Load a library child previously serialized with XhiveLibraryChildIf.serialize(java.io.OutputStream).

Parameters:
in - The input stream to read from. No buffering is done internally, so be sure to use a java.io.BufferedInputStream where it matters.
Returns:
The library child read. It is not yet appended to this library, so if it must be stored in the database you will have to call Node.appendChild(org.w3c.dom.Node) or Node.insertBefore(org.w3c.dom.Node, org.w3c.dom.Node).
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Only if the input stream passed throws a java.io.IOException.
Since:
X-Hive/DB 5.1
